packagegui.name: squidreverse
packagegui.title: Proxy server: Reverse Proxy

field.description: The interface(s) the reverse-proxy server will bind to.
Squid will additionally bind to this user-defined IPs for reverse-proxy operation. Useful for virtual IPs such as CARP. Separate by semi-colons (;).
The external full-qualified-domain-name of the WAN address.

field.fielddescr: Reset TCP connections if request is unauthorized
field.description: If this field is checked, the reverse-proxy will reset the TCP connection if the request is unauthorized.

If this field is checked, the proxy-server will act in HTTP reverse mode.
(You have to add a rule with destination "WAN-address")
This is the port the HTTP reverse-proxy will listen on. (leave empty to use 80)
This is the HTTP reverse default site. (leave empty to use the external fqdn)

If this field is checked, the proxy-server will act in HTTPS reverse mode.
(You have to add a rule with destination "WAN-address")
This is the port the HTTPS reverse-proxy will listen on. (leave empty to use 443)
This is the HTTPS reverse default site. (leave empty to use the external fqdn)
Choose the SSL Server Certificate here.
Paste a signed certificate in X.509 PEM format here.
If this field is checked, internal certificate validation will be ignored.
If this field is checked, squid will act as an accelerator/ SSL offloader for Outlook Web App.
These are the internal IPs of the CAS-Array (OWA frontend servers). Separate by semi-colons (;).
If this field is checked, ActiveSync will be enabled.
If this field is checked, RPC over HTTP will be enabled.

If this field is checked, MAPI over HTTP will be enabled.
This feature is only available with at least Exchange 2013 SP1

If this field is checked, Exchange WebServices will be enabled.
There are potential DoS side effects to its use, please avoid unless you must.

If this field is checked, AutoDiscover will be enabled.
You also should set up the autodiscover DNS-record to point to you WAN-IP.

Enter each peer definition on a new line. Directives have to be separated by a semicolon(;).
syntax: [peer alias];[internal ip address];[port];[HTTP / HTTPS]
example: HOST1;192.168.0.1;80;HTTP
WRONG SYNTAX USAGE WILL RESULT IN SQUID NOT STARTING

Enter each reverse acl definition on a new line. Directives have to be separated by a semicolon(;)
syntax: [group the uri belongs to];[URI to publish](;[vhost fqdn])
(a group can contain multiple URIs, without vhost fqdn the external fqdn is used, you also can specity http:// or https://)
example: URI1;public;server.pfsense.org.
WRONG SYNTAX USAGE WILL RESULT IN SQUID NOT STARTING

Enter each reverse acl definition on a new line. Directives have to be separated by a semicolon(;).
syntax: [peer alias];[uri group alias]
example: HOST1;URI1
WRONG SYNTAX USAGE WILL RESULT IN SQUID NOT STARTING
